name: Amazon ECS
description: Amazon Elastic Container Service is a scalable, container management service that is used to manage containers in a cluster. With dashboards for Amazon ECS, you can monitor capacity and resource utilization of ECS components as well as quickly identify changes made to your clusters to help with troubleshooting.

children.name: 1. Amazon ECS - Overview
children.description: The Amazon ECS - Overview dashboard provides an overview of CPU and memory utilization across all your ECS clusters and services. The customer upon checking the dashboard can determine which services are high in utilization and accordingly make decisions for the ECS deployment.
children.title: 1. Amazon ECS - Overview

queries.queryString: account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} ClusterName={{clustername}} | sum by ClusterName, account, region, namespace | count

account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} Metric=CPUUtilization ClusterName={{clustername}} ServiceName={{servicename}} statistic=samplecount | sum by account, region, namespace, ClusterName, ServiceName | sum
account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} metric=CPUUtilization statistic=Average ClusterName={{clustername}} | avg by ClusterName, account, region, namespace
account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} metric=MemoryUtilization statistic=Average ClusterName={{clustername}} | avg by ClusterName, account, region, namespace
account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} metric=CPUReservation statistic=Average ClusterName={{clustername}} | avg by ClusterName, account, region, namespace
account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} metric=MemoryReservation statistic=Average ClusterName={{clustername}} | avg by ClusterName, account, region, namespace
account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} metric=GPUReservation statistic=Average ClusterName={{clustername}} | avg by ClusterName, account, region, namespace

account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} metric=CPUUtilization statistic=Average ClusterName={{clustername}} ServiceName={{servicename}} | avg by ClusterName, ServiceName, account, region, namespace

account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} metric=MemoryUtilization statistic=Average ClusterName={{clustername}} ServiceName={{servicename}} | avg by ClusterName, ServiceName, account, region, namespace
account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} metric=CPUUtilization statistic=Average ClusterName={{clustername}} | avg
account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} metric=CPUUtilization statistic=Average ClusterName={{clustername}} ServiceName={{servicename}} | avg
account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} metric=MemoryUtilization statistic=Average ClusterName={{clustername}} | avg
account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} metric=CPUReservation statistic=Average ClusterName={{clustername}} | avg
account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} metric=MemoryReservation statistic=Average ClusterName={{clustername}} | avg
account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} metric=CPUUtilization statistic=Average clustername={{clustername}} | avg by clustername, account, region
account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} metric=MemoryUtilization statistic=Average clustername={{clustername}} | avg by clustername, account, region
account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} metric=MemoryUtilization statistic=Average ClusterName={{clustername}} ServiceName={{servicename}} | avg

account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} metric=CPUUtilization statistic=Average clustername={{clustername}} servicename={{servicename}} | avg by clustername, servicename, account, region

account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} metric=MemoryUtilization statistic=Average clustername={{clustername}} servicename={{servicename}} | avg by clustername, servicename, account, region

account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} Metric=CPUUtilization ClusterName={{clustername}} ServiceName={{servicename}} | sum by account, region, namespace, ClusterName, ServiceName | count

children.name: 1. Amazon ECS - Resource Utilization
children.description: The Amazon ECS - Resource Utilization dashboard provides trends around CPU and Memory utilization for clusters and services.
children.title: 1. Amazon ECS - Resource Utilization

queries.queryString: account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} metric=CPUUtilization Statistic=Average ClusterName={{clustername}} | avg by ClusterName, account, region, namespace
account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} metric=MemoryUtilization Statistic=Average ClusterName={{clustername}} | avg by ClusterName, account, region, namespace

account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} metric=CPUUtilization Statistic=Average ClusterName={{clustername}} ServiceName={{servicename}}  | avg by ClusterName, ServiceName, account, region, namespace

account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} metric=MemoryUtilization Statistic=Average ClusterName={{clustername}} ServiceName={{servicename}} | avg by ClusterName, ServiceName, account, region, namespace

panels.title: Note
panels.text:
- **CPU Utilization**: The percentage of CPU units that are used in the cluster or service.

- **Memory Utilization**: The percentage of memory that is used in the cluster or service.

These metrics are available for both ECS clusters and services.

All Amazon ECS services using the Fargate launch type are enabled for CloudWatch CPU and memory utilization metrics automatically.

For more information: [Amazon ECS CloudWatch metrics](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/developerguide/cloudwatch-metrics.html)

children.name: 2. Amazon ECS - Audit Events
children.description: The Amazon ECS - Audit Events dashboard provides insights into changes to your ECS environment including top IAM users, locations of events. The dashboard also shows the created, updated, and deleted events with respect to time, along with the details for the top 10 AWS Identity and Access Management users, and the last 20 Container Registration and Deregistration Events.
children.title: 2. Amazon ECS - Audit Events

queries.queryString:
account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} "\"eventSource\":\"ecs.amazonaws.com\""
| json "eventName", "eventSource", "awsRegion", "requestParameters", "sourceIPAddress" as event_name, event_source, Region, requestParameters, src_ip nodrop
| where event_source = "ecs.amazonaws.com"
| json field=requestParameters "cluster" as clustername nodrop
| where tolowercase(clustername) matches tolowercase("{{clustername}}")
| parse "\"userName\":\"*\"" as user nodrop
| parse "\"ec2InstanceId\":\"*\"" as ec2InstanceId nodrop
| count as event_count by event_name
| sort by event_count, event_name asc

account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} "\"eventSource\":\"ecs.amazonaws.com\""
| json "eventName", "eventSource", "awsRegion", "requestParameters", "sourceIPAddress" as event_name, event_source, Region, requestParameters, src_ip nodrop
| where event_source = "ecs.amazonaws.com"
| json field=requestParameters "cluster" as clustername nodrop
| where tolowercase(clustername) matches tolowercase("{{clustername}}")
| parse "\"userName\":\"*\"" as user nodrop
| parse "\"ec2InstanceId\":\"*\"" as ec2InstanceId nodrop
| timeslice 1h
| count as event_count by event_name, _timeslice
| transpose row _timeslice column event_name

account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} "\"eventSource\":\"ecs.amazonaws.com\"" sourceIPAddress
| json "eventName", "eventSource", "awsRegion", "requestParameters", "sourceIPAddress" as event_name, event_source, Region, requestParameters, src_ip nodrop
| where event_source = "ecs.amazonaws.com" and !(src_ip matches "*.amazonaws.com")
| json field=requestParameters "cluster" as clustername nodrop
| where tolowercase(clustername) matches tolowercase("{{clustername}}")
| parse "\"userName\":\"*\"" as user nodrop
| parse "\"ec2InstanceId\":\"*\"" as ec2InstanceId nodrop
| count by src_ip
| lookup latitude, longitude, country_code, country_name, region, city, postal_code from geo://location on ip = src_ip
| where !isNull(latitude)

account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} "\"eventSource\":\"ecs.amazonaws.com\"" (CreateCluster or CreateService or RegisterContainerInstance or RegisterTaskDefinition or RunTask)
| json "eventName", "eventSource", "awsRegion", "requestParameters", "sourceIPAddress" as event_name, event_source, Region, requestParameters, src_ip nodrop
| where event_source = "ecs.amazonaws.com"
| json field=requestParameters "cluster" as clustername nodrop
| where tolowercase(clustername) matches tolowercase("{{clustername}}")
| parse "\"userName\":\"*\"" as user nodrop
| parse "\"ec2InstanceId\":\"*\"" as ec2InstanceId nodrop
| parse regex field=event_name "^(?:Create|Run|Register)(?<resource_type>[A-Z][A-Za-z]+)" nodrop
| count as event_count by resource_type | sort by event_count, resource_type asc

account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} "\"eventSource\":\"ecs.amazonaws.com\"" (DeleteCluster or DeleteService or DeregisterContainerInstance or DeregisterTaskDefinition or StopTask)
| json "eventName", "eventSource", "awsRegion", "requestParameters", "sourceIPAddress" as event_name, event_source, Region, requestParameters, src_ip nodrop
| where event_source = "ecs.amazonaws.com"
| json field=requestParameters "cluster" as clustername nodrop
| where tolowercase(clustername) matches tolowercase("{{clustername}}")
| parse "\"userName\":\"*\"" as user nodrop
| parse "\"ec2InstanceId\":\"*\"" as ec2InstanceId nodrop
| parse regex field=event_name "^(?:Delete|Deregister|Stop)(?<resource_type>[A-Z][A-Za-z]+)" nodrop
| count as event_count by resource_type
| sort by event_count, resource_type asc

account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} "\"eventSource\":\"ecs.amazonaws.com\"" (CreateCluster or CreateService or RegisterContainerInstance or RegisterTaskDefinition or RunTask)
| json "eventName", "eventSource", "awsRegion", "requestParameters", "sourceIPAddress" as event_name, event_source, Region, requestParameters, src_ip nodrop
| where event_source = "ecs.amazonaws.com"
| json field=requestParameters "cluster" as clustername nodrop
| where tolowercase(clustername) matches tolowercase("{{clustername}}")
| parse "\"userName\":\"*\"" as user nodrop
| parse "\"ec2InstanceId\":\"*\"" as ec2InstanceId nodrop
| parse regex field=event_name "^(?:Create|Run|Register)(?<resource_type>[A-Z][A-Za-z]+)" nodrop
| timeslice 1h
| count as event_count by resource_type, _timeslice
| transpose row _timeslice column resource_type

account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} "\"eventSource\":\"ecs.amazonaws.com\"" (DeleteCluster or DeleteService or DeregisterContainerInstance or DeregisterTaskDefinition or StopTask) !(InternalFailure)
| json "eventName", "eventSource", "awsRegion", "requestParameters", "sourceIPAddress" as event_name, event_source, Region, requestParameters, src_ip nodrop
| where event_source = "ecs.amazonaws.com"
| json field=requestParameters "cluster" as clustername nodrop
| where tolowercase(clustername) matches tolowercase("{{clustername}}")
| parse "\"userName\":\"*\"" as user nodrop
| parse "\"ec2InstanceId\":\"*\"" as ec2InstanceId nodrop
| parse regex field=event_name "^(?:Delete|Deregister|Stop)(?<resource_type>[A-Z][A-Za-z]+)" nodrop
| timeslice 1h
| count as event_count by resource_type, _timeslice
| transpose row _timeslice column resource_type

panels.title: Last 20 Container Registration and Deregistration Events

queries.queryString:
account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} "\"eventSource\":\"ecs.amazonaws.com\"" (RegisterContainerInstance or DeregisterContainerInstance)
| json "eventName", "eventSource", "awsRegion", "requestParameters", "sourceIPAddress" as event_name, event_source, Region, requestParameters, src_ip nodrop
| where event_source = "ecs.amazonaws.com" and event_name in ("RegisterContainerInstance", "DeregisterContainerInstance")
| json field=requestParameters "cluster" as clustername nodrop
| where tolowercase(clustername) matches tolowercase("{{clustername}}")
| parse "\"userName\":\"*\"" as user nodrop
| parse "\"ec2InstanceId\":\"*\"" as ec2_instanceid nodrop
| parse regex field=event_name "^(?<event>[Register|Deregister]+)(?<resource_type>[A-Z][A-Za-z]+)" nodrop
| timeslice 1s
| count _timeslice, event, resource_type, region, clustername, ec2_instanceid
| fields -_count
| sort _timeslice
| limit 20
//| fields -_count

account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} "\"eventSource\":\"ecs.amazonaws.com\""
| json "eventName", "eventSource", "awsRegion", "requestParameters", "sourceIPAddress" as event_name, event_source, Region, requestParameters, src_ip nodrop
| where event_source = "ecs.amazonaws.com"
| json field=requestParameters "cluster" as clustername nodrop
| where tolowercase(clustername) matches tolowercase("{{clustername}}")
| parse "\"userName\":\"*\"" as user nodrop
| parse "\"ec2InstanceId\":\"*\"" as ec2InstanceId nodrop
| count as event_count by user
| sort by event_count 
| limit 10

account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} "\"eventSource\":\"ecs.amazonaws.com\"" *update*
| json "eventName", "eventSource", "awsRegion", "requestParameters", "sourceIPAddress" as event_name, event_source, Region, requestParameters, src_ip nodrop
| where event_source = "ecs.amazonaws.com" and (event_name matches "*Update*" or event_name matches "*update*")
| json field=requestParameters "cluster" as clustername nodrop
| where tolowercase(clustername) matches tolowercase("{{clustername}}")
| parse "\"userName\":\"*\"" as user nodrop
| parse "\"ec2InstanceId\":\"*\"" as ec2InstanceId nodrop
| parse regex field=event_name "^(?:Update)(?<resource_type>[A-Z][A-Za-z]+)" nodrop
| count as event_count by resource_type
| sort by event_count, resource_type asc

account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}}  "\"eventSource\":\"ecs.amazonaws.com\"" *update*
| json "eventName", "eventSource", "awsRegion", "requestParameters", "sourceIPAddress" as event_name, event_source, Region, requestParameters, src_ip nodrop
| where event_source = "ecs.amazonaws.com" and event_name matches "Update*"
| json field=requestParameters "cluster" as clustername nodrop
| where tolowercase(clustername) matches tolowercase("{{clustername}}")
| parse "\"userName\":\"*\"" as user nodrop
| parse "\"ec2InstanceId\":\"*\"" as ec2InstanceId nodrop
| parse regex field=event_name "^(?:Update)(?<resource_type>[A-Z][A-Za-z]+)" nodrop
| timeslice 1h
| count by resource_type, _timeslice
| transpose row _timeslice column resource_type

children.name: 2. Amazon ECS - Resource Reservation
children.description: The Amazon ECS - Resource Reservation dashboard provides detailed insights into the average reservation (units utilized) by CPU, Memory, and GPU for a given cluster.
children.title: 2. Amazon ECS - Resource Reservation

queries.queryString: account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} metric=CPUReservation Statistic=Average ClusterName={{clustername}} | avg by ClusterName, account, region, namespace
account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} metric=MemoryReservation Statistic=Average ClusterName={{clustername}} | avg by ClusterName, account, region, namespace
account={{account}} region={{region}} namespace={{namespace}} metric=GPUReservation Statistic=Average ClusterName={{clustername}} | max by ClusterName, account, region, namespace

panels.title: Note
panels.text:
- **CPU Reservation**: The percentage of CPU units that are reserved by running tasks in the cluster.

- **Memory Reservation**: The percentage of memory that is reserved by running tasks in the cluster.

- **GPU Reservation**: The percentage of total available GPUs that are reserved by running tasks in the cluster.

These metrics are available for clusters only.

For more information: [Amazon ECS CloudWatch metrics](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/developerguide/cloudwatch-metrics.html)
